availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City & County of New York SS:

I, Franklin A. Wilcox, residing in said city of New York, appointed by the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, a Commissioner for Kentucky, resident in said city, pursuant to an act of the General Assembly, of said Commonwealth, entitled "An act to adopt the Revised Statutes" approved January 7th 1852 (chapter 70), do solemnly swear that I will well and truly execute all the duties of such station, so help me God.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 20th day of July A.D. 1864

Jno. T. M. Gowan
Notary Public
City & County of New York

figure.ab:
JOHN T. M. GOWAN
NEW YORK
NOTARY PUBLIC

body.p:
Seal of office
F. A. WILCOX
KENTUCKY
COMMISSIONER IN NEW YORK

Comr Deeds
Oath of F. A. Wilcox New York
filed 25th July/64
